column4: hey guys/gals need some help here. I've installed Ubuntu Maverick on a couple systems and now Linux Mint 10 on another and every single one after restart, Network Manager is not visible in the tray. I have to run "killall NetworkManager" and it pops up. Any ideas?
have you tried removing/adding to the panel?
no I haven't. How would I do that?
you right-click on it and select remove, then right-click on the panel and select add
if I right-click on the panel, i can't remove it. If i right-click on the NetworkManager icon I can't remove that either. I am currently testingon Mint.
do you see the little vertical hash marks on the panel?
sorry, no vertical hashes on the panel
it's just wierd. I have to kill NetworkManager before I can see it.
can you pastebin a screen capture with the network manager on the panel?
sorry it's on another computer. I am not even sure how I would send a screenshot via IRC.
the notification-applet looks like little speed bumps, it houses several icons...
I understand what you are reffering to as I see it in Debian but loks like Mint has added some "elegance" so the panel is at the bottom and is completely smooth with no breaks.
hmmm.... i have lm10 but not on this machine.
thanx for the info anyway. might have just given me the direction I needed to figure it out.
i'm gonna go fire up the VM and see for myself...
ok
ok, on mine the network indicator and the update-manager are both in the bottom right corner with three little hash marks to the left of the update-manager.
hard to see...
Land of Magic
I also notice, on Debian if I run that command the app dies and stays dead. In Ubuntu and Mint it re-launched automatically.
the only thing I can try to tell you is try ##gnome at this point. I'm still looking aroound.
I don't have WICD installed but ifdown is possible. This is a fresh install so I have not made any customizations and this seems to be the same behavior for the last thre installs.
